DOC.brief_title: Effects Nasal High Flow Therapy Ventilation Gas Exchange Healthy Newborns
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study investigate effect NHF therapy ventilation gas exchange wakefulness sleep healthy term newborn . Interventions : NHF apply 8 L/min ( AIRVO 2 ) via ( OPT 316 ) Optiflow nasal cannula interface without supplemental oxygen . Participants act control ( intervention ) randomize crossover study design . Physiological measurement : 1 . Ventilation assess use Respiratory Inductance Plethysmography ( RIP ) ( Respitrace QDC , Viasys , USA ) . 2 . Blood carbon dioxide ( CO2 ) oxygen level measure non-invasive transcutaneous monitor ( Tosca , Radiometer , Demnark ) . 3 . All experiment record use Analogue-to-Digital converter ( Powerlab , ADInstruments , New Zealand ) LabChart software video record patient . 4 . Sleep/awake status determine videorecording patient Electroencephalogram ( EEG ) ( Alice Polysomnography System Philips , USA ) 5 . The total study time < 3 hour total participant . Routine measurement heart rate , respiratory rate oxygen saturation perform per standard neonatal clinical practice . 6 . Intervention terminate time SpO2 drop 80 % , TcCO2 increase 60 mm Hg , Respiratory Rate increase 80 breath per min one minute ) . The researcher experience neonatal consultant conduct research observe baby throughout study . Protocol : Both control NHF intervention period last maximum 40 min . The maximum duration study include set-up , calibration , intervention , washout an control < 3 hour . At begin study probe attach self-calibration period RIP follow calibration breathing volume pneumotachometer attach nasal mask . After calibration complete baseline measurement follow either NHF 8 L/min control period without NHF . At end period intervention change either control NHF , follow washout period ( NHF ) additional calibration RIP pneumotachometer .
DOC.criteria: Healthy full near fullterm newborn 12 day age . A parent give write informed consent baby 's participation . Infants clinically unstable unsuitable noninvasive respiratory support judge consultant clinician require supplemental oxygen . Known upper airway , low respiratory tract , cardiac gastrointestinal tract anomaly . A parent give write informed consent .
